affymetrix.calvin.data
Class DataSetColumnReader

java.lang.Object
  affymetrix.calvin.data.DataSetColumnReader

public class DataSetColumnReader
extends java.lang.Object

Utilities to read data from a DataSet in a column-based fashion.

Author:
Garret Wilson, Ed Erwin

Method Detail

getDataFloats

public static final float[] getDataFloats(DataSet dataSet,
                                          int column,
                                          int rowStart,
                                          int rowEnd)
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          UnsignedOutOfLimitsException,
                                          RowIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                          ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException
Retrieves the floats in a particular column from the given rows.

Parameters:
dataSet - The data set from which to retrieve the data.
column - the zero-based index of the column
rowStart - the zero-based index of the first row, inclusive
rowEnd - the zero-based index of the last row, exclusive
Returns:
The float values of the data in the given column in the data set.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given data set is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given column type is not a ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.FloatColType.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading from the data set.
UnsignedOutOfLimitsException - if an unsigned value was outside its allowed range.
RowIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either of the row values is not valid, or if rowEnd is greater than rowStart.
ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the column value is not valid.

getDataIntegers

public static final int[] getDataIntegers(DataSet dataSet,
                                          int column,
                                          int rowStart,
                                          int rowEnd)
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          UnsignedOutOfLimitsException,
                                          RowIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                          ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException
Retrieves the integers in a particular column from the given rows. If an unsigned integer is larger than Java integers allow, an IOException will be thrown.

Parameters:
dataSet - The data set from which to retrieve the data.
column - the zero-based index of the column
rowStart - the zero-based index of the first row, inclusive
rowEnd - the zero-based index of the last row, exclusive
Returns:
The integers values of the data in the given column in the data set.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given data set is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given column type is not a ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.ByteColType, ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.IntColType, ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.ShortColType, ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.UByteColType, a ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.UIntColType, or a ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.UShortColType.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading from the data set.
UnsignedOutOfLimitsException - if an unsigned value was outside its allowed range.
RowIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either of the row values is not valid, or if rowEnd is greater than rowStart.
ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the column value is not valid.
See Also:
Integer.MAX_VALUE

getDataLongs

public static final long[] getDataLongs(DataSet dataSet,
                                        int column,
                                        int rowStart,
                                        int rowEnd)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        UnsignedOutOfLimitsException,
                                        RowIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                        ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException
Retrieves the unsigned integer data in a particular column from the given rows as an array of java "long".

Parameters:
dataSet - The data set from which to retrieve the data.
column - the zero-based index of the column
rowStart - the zero-based index of the first row, inclusive
rowEnd - the zero-based index of the last row, exclusive
Returns:
The integers values of the data in the given column in the data set.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given data set is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given column type is not a ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.UIntColType.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading from the data set.
UnsignedOutOfLimitsException - if an unsigned value was outside its allowed range.
RowIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either of the row values is not valid, or if rowEnd is greater than rowStart.
ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the column value is not valid.
See Also:
Integer.MAX_VALUE

getDataStrings

public static final java.lang.String[] getDataStrings(DataSet dataSet,
                                                      int column,
                                                      int rowStart,
                                                      int rowEnd)
                                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                                      UnsignedOutOfLimitsException,
                                                      RowIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                                      ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException
Retrieves the String data in a particular column from the given rows. The data is stored in java Strings, which use 2 bytes per character even to hold data which could fit in a single byte per character.

Parameters:
dataSet - The data set from which to retrieve the data.
column - the zero-based index of the column
rowStart - the zero-based index of the first row, inclusive
rowEnd - the zero-based index of the last row, exclusive
Returns:
The CharSequence values of the data in the given column in the data set.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given data set is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given column type is not a ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.ASCIICharColType or a ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.UnicodeCharColType.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading from the data set.
UnsignedOutOfLimitsException - if an unsigned value was outside its allowed range.
RowIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either of the row values is not valid, or if rowEnd is greater than rowStart.
ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the column value is not valid.

getDataBytes

public static final byte[] getDataBytes(DataSet dataSet,
                                        int column,
                                        int rowStart,
                                        int rowEnd)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        UnsignedOutOfLimitsException,
                                        RowIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                        ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException
Retrieves the signed or unsigned bytes in a particular column from the given rows. The returned values are bytes, but should be interpreted as signed or unsigned depending on whether the column type is ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.ByteColType or ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.UByteColType.

Parameters:
dataSet - The data set from which to retrieve the data.
column - the zero-based index of the column
rowStart - the zero-based index of the first row, inclusive
rowEnd - the zero-based index of the last row, exclusive
Returns:
The unsigned bytes values of the data in the given column in the data set.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given data set is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given column type is not ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.ByteColType or ColumnInfo.DataSetColumnTypes.UByteColType.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading from the data set.
UnsignedOutOfLimitsException - if an unsigned value was outside its allowed range.
RowIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either of the row values is not valid, or if rowEnd is greater than rowStart.
ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the column value is not valid.

checkBounds

private static void checkBounds(DataSet dataSet,
                                int rowStart,
                                int rowEnd,
                                int column)
                         throws RowIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException
Check that the given column and range of rows is in bounds. Do nothing if it is in bounds, otherwise throw an exception.

Parameters:
dataSet - the DataSet
rowStart - the zero-based index of the first row, inclusive
rowEnd - the zero-based index of the last row, exclusive
column - the zero-based index of the column
Throws:
RowIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either of the row values is not valid, or if rowEnd is greater than rowStart.
ColumnIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the column value is not valid.
